Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output

common_issues.title: Copilot Unresponsive, Not Generating Feedback
common_issues.description: Users report Copilot not responding in conversations or extensions (VS Code, Chrome) across Windows, macOS, and Linux. Copilot continuously loads, sometimes updating conversation summaries or names, but doesn't respond in chat.  Troubleshooting steps like resetting, restarting, reinstalling, and switching between On-Device and Cloud LLMs have been unsuccessful.  Log files contain Sentry Event Errors.  One user also reported issues installing locally hosted models.

related_issues.title: Copilot not responding
related_issues.text:
Copilot not responding
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS: 11.3.3 - Pieces for Developers: 4.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey all,
Pieces Copilot no longer responds in conversations in the app, or through any of the extensions (VS Code/Chrome). It just keeps loading. I've tried hard-resetting, restarting, reinstalling, On-Device LLMs, and Cloud LLMs. The weird thing is, some of the conversations will have a summary or will update the name of the conversation, but it never responds in the chat. I looked at the logs and saw repeated Sentry Event Errors, but not sure what to do with that.  I attached the log file from the day before yesterday (yesterday's is too large and won't upload). What should I do?

Thanks!

[log-04292025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19997109/log-04292025.txt)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot not responding or generating output
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot not responding in conversations within the app or extensions (VS Code, Chrome).  Symptoms include continuous loading, lack of responses in chat, and potential Sentry Event Errors in logs.  Some conversation summaries or name updates may still function.  Issue affects Windows and macOS, across various Pieces OS and extension versions.  Troubleshooting steps like resets, restarts, reinstalls, and switching between On-Device and Cloud LLMs have been unsuccessful.  One user reported a conflict with Visual Studio's Diagnostic Tools, resolved by disabling the Pieces plugin.

related_issues.title: Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output
related_issues.text: Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Visual Studio ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version PiecesOS 11.3.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. The Diagnostic tools pane that, by default, opens when you begin debugging in Visual Studio ends up entirely blank with the Pieces plugin enabled in Visual Studio Version 17.14.0 Preview 4.0. Disabling the plugin restores the Diagnostic tools output. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers and OS connection issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing connection issues between Pieces for Developers and Pieces OS on Linux and macOS.  Problems include invalid port errors, login failures with HTTP 500 errors, and Copilot failing to provide feedback.  Check Pieces OS logs for error messages and ensure proper port configuration. Verify Pieces for Developers and OS versions for compatibility.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Copilot Unresponsive" issue affecting Windows, macOS, and Linux users across VS Code, Chrome, and Desktop app. Investigate Sentry Event Errors and local model installation issues.
Address Pieces Copilot and OS connection problems on Linux and macOS. Check port configurations, logs, and version compatibility between Pieces for Developers and OS.
Investigate the HTTP 500 error during OS login on Linux.  Review related logs and error messages.
Look into the invalid port error ("http://0.0.0.0:null/connect") reported on Linux. Ensure correct port configuration in Pieces for Developers and OS.
Address the Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with Diagnostic Tools on Windows. Ensure compatibility and consider a workaround or fix for affected users.
Proactively monitor and address the "Copilot not giving any feedback" issue on macOS and other platforms. This may be related to the broader Copilot unresponsiveness problem.
Improve communication with users experiencing Copilot issues. Provide updates, workarounds, or temporary solutions while a fix is being developed.
Collect more detailed logs and system information from affected users to aid in debugging and resolution of Copilot and connection issues.
Consider adding troubleshooting steps for common Copilot issues to the Pieces documentation or support resources.
Review and update the local LLM model installation process on Linux to address reported issues and improve user experience.
Analyze support tickets for trends and patterns to identify potential areas for improvement in the software or documentation.

Prioritize bug fixes and improvements based on the frequency and impact of reported issues, focusing on those affecting the most users and core functionality like Copilot responsiveness and OS connectivity.
